body.p: Arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable, similar to lists but with fixed sizes and homogeneous elements. Arrays are used to store collections of elements of the same data type. They are more memory-efficient than lists when dealing with large datasets.

section.title: Example
section.codeblock: # Example of arrays import array as arr my_array = arr.array('i', [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) print(my_array[0]) # Output: 1
